dt: used as a function word to indicate connection or addition especially of items within the same class or type
used to join sentence elements of the same grammatical rank or function
used as a function word to express logical modification, consequence, antithesis, or supplementary explanation
used as a function word to join one finite verb (such as {it}go, come, try{/it}) to another so that together they are logically equivalent to an infinitive of purpose
used in logic to form a conjunction
{bc}and others or more of the same or similar kind
{bc}further in the same or similar manner

et: Middle English, from Old English; akin to Old High German {it}unti{/it} and
shortdef: —used as a function word to indicate connection or addition especially of items within the same class or type—used to join sentence elements of the same grammatical rank or function
—used as a function word to express logical modification, consequence, antithesis, or supplementary explanation
—used as a function word to join one finite verb (such as go, come, try) to another so that together they are logically equivalent to an infinitive of purpose

dt: {bc}a logical operator that requires both of two inputs to be present or two conditions to be met for an output to be made or a statement to be executed

shortdef: a logical operator that requires both of two inputs to be present or two conditions to be met for an output to be made or a statement to be executed

dt: used to emphasize the preceding idea
used in measurements of time, distance, weight, etc., to indicate one half of the stated unit of measurement

dt.t: My daughter is two and a {it}half{/it} (years old).
The fish was a foot {it}and a half{/it} long.

dt: used to say that something is very good, large, difficult, etc.

dt.t: That was a meal {it}and a half{/it}!
Renovating a house is a job {it}and a half{/it}.

shortdef: —used in measurements of time, distance, weight, etc., to indicate one half of the stated unit of measurement
—used to say that something is very good, large, difficult, etc.

dt.t: It's too expensive, {it}and anyway{/it}, we don't have enough time to do it.

dt: used to say that something is easy to do or use

dt.t: Just complete the form, pay the fee, {it}and Bob's your uncle{/it}!

shortdef: —used to say that something is easy to do or use

dt.t: There's only six minutes {it}and change{/it} left in the game.

shortdef: and a very small additional amount

dt.t: I like being out in the forest with all the birds and trees {it}and everything{/it}.
He has a lot on his mind, what with his health problems {it}and everything{/it}.

dt: used to stress the truth or accuracy of a statement

dt.t: She's the one I saw, {it}and no mistake{/it}.

shortdef: —used to stress the truth or accuracy of a statement

dt: used to refer to something that is additional to something already mentioned

dt.t: The company has been having problems, financial {it}and otherwise{/it}, for several years.

shortdef: —used to refer to something that is additional to something already mentioned
